org.eleusoft.uri
Class URIFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.eleusoft.uri.URIFactory

public final class URIFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Entry point - This class offers static factory methods for creating an URI.

Method Detail

isAbsoluteURI

public static final boolean isAbsoluteURI(java.lang.String uri)
                                   throws URIException
Throws:
URIException

parseScheme

public static final java.lang.String[] parseScheme(java.lang.String uri)
                                            throws URIException
Parses an uri extracting the scheme when present. This method returns an array of two strings. When there is a scheme the scheme is returned as first item of the array and the remaining or whole part is in the second item.

When there is no scheme the first item in the array is null and the second contains the passed uri.

This method does not check if the scheme specific part respects the generic uri syntax rules.

Throws:
URIException - when the passed uri starts with colon char ':'

extractFragment

public static final java.lang.String[] extractFragment(java.lang.String uri)
Parses an uri extracting the fragment when present. This method returns an array of two strings.
  1. The first item of the array contains the passed URI without the fragment component, that means all the string content that preceeds the first '#' symbol or all the content if there is no '#'. that is not a fragment. The first item will never be null.
  2. The second item of the array contains the fragment component, if present, otherwise null; when the fragment is present it might be also a zero length string.

    This method does not check if the URI specific part respects the generic uri syntax rules.

extractOpaquePart

public static final java.lang.String[] extractOpaquePart(java.lang.String uri)
                                                  throws URIException
Returns the scheme and opaque part of an opaque URI, null if the URI is not opaque..MAY BE NO MUCH SENSE IN THIS..

Throws:
URIException

uncheckedCreateURI

public static final URI uncheckedCreateURI(java.lang.String uri)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Same as createURI(String) but throws IllegalArgumentException. It's use is intended for static constants.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when calling the createURI(String) method passing the same uri as parameter throws URIException.

createURI

public static final URI createURI(java.lang.String scheme,
                                  java.lang.String schemeSpecificPart)
                           throws URIException
Creates an URI instance from its scheme and escaped scheme specific part.

Parameters:
scheme - the scheme
schemeSpecificPart - the (escaped) scheme specific part
Returns:
an URI instance, never null
Throws:
URIException - when
  • The syntax of the scheme is wrong.
  • The syntax of the scheme specific part uri is wrong.

createURI

public static final URI createURI(java.lang.String escaped)
                           throws URIException
Creates an URI instance from its escaped string form.

Parameters:
escaped - the escaped uri
Returns:
an URI instance, never null
Throws:
URIException - when
  • The syntax of the escaped uri is wrong.

createURI

public static final URI createURI(java.lang.String scheme,
                                  java.lang.String auth,
                                  java.lang.String path,
                                  java.lang.String query,
                                  java.lang.String fragment)
                           throws URIException
Creates an URI instance from the components of an hierarchical uri .

Parameters:
scheme - the scheme component, might be null or not empty. Passing an empty string as scheme is an error and will cause an IllegalArgumentException.
auth - the authority component, might be null or be non empty. Passing an empty authority must be interpreted by implementation as a null authority.
path - the unescaped path If a URI contains an authority component, then the path component must either be empty or begin with a slash ("/") character. Cannot be null.
query - the escaped query
fragment - the un-escaped fragment
Returns:
an URI instance, never null
Throws:
URIException - when one of the components is wrong for its syntax or for the context, for example when the path is null or when
  • Scheme is an empty string.
  • Authority is an empty string.
  • Authority is null and path starts with "//"

decode

public static final java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String encoded,
                                            java.lang.String encoding)
                                     throws URIException
Decodes an percent-escaped string following URI rules and using the passed encoding.

Note: + remains +, while following URL rules it becomes a space.

Returns:
the decoded string, never null
Throws:
URIException - when
  • The syntax of the escaped uri is wrong.

decode

public static final java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String encoded)
                                     throws URIException
Decodes an percent-escaped string following URI rules and using the UTF-8 encoding.

Note: + remains +, while following URL rules it becomes a space.

Returns:
the decoded string, never null
Throws:
URIException - when
  • The syntax of the escaped uri is wrong.

public static final java.lang.String encodeQueryPart(java.lang.String decoded,
                                                     java.lang.String encoding)
Percent-escapes a string following rules for single param name or param value of a URI query component and using the passed encoding.

Returns:
the percent-escaped string, never null

Returns:
the percent-escaped string, never null
